sen.j: 粟原寺（おうばらでら）は、奈良県桜井市粟原にかつてあった寺。
sen.e: Obara-dera Temple was once located in Obara, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.
Obara-dera was a temple once located in Obara, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Temple was > was a temple once.
sen.e: Obara-dera was a temple once located in Obara, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 創立は7世紀末にさかのぼる。
sen.e: It was founded in the late seventh century.
It was founded in the late seventh century.
It was founded in the late seventh century.

sen.j: 現在は廃寺となり建物などは残っていないが、寺の跡は『粟原寺跡』として国の史跡に指定されている（1927年4月8日指定）。
sen.e: Although the temple was closed and no other building remains, the site is designated as a historic site, "the site of Obara-dera Temple" (designated on April 8. 1927).
Although the temple was abolished and no buildings remain to the present day, the site has been designated as a National Historical Landmark (as of April 8th, 1927).
sen.cmt: closed > abolished. other building remains > no buildings remain. is > has been. historic site > National Historical Landmark.
sen.e: Although the temple was abolished and no buildings remain to the present day, the site has been designated as a National Historical Landmark (as of April 8th, 1927).

sen.j: 大宇陀から女寄峠を越えて桜井に抜ける忍阪街道（現在の国道166号線）の中ほどの丘陵地に粟原の集落があり、その南の端に天満神社がある。
sen.e: Tenman-jinja Shrine is located in the southern end of the village of Obara in the hilly area halfway down Ossaka-kaido Road (National Route 166) connecting from Ouda to Sakurai through Meyori-toge Pass.
sen.cmt: 女寄峠：「めよりとうげ」または「みよりとうげ」と呼ばれているようですが、「めよりとうげ」として訳してあります。http://core.the-orj.org/pdb/index.php?st%5B%5D=6&eq%5B%5D==&word%5B%5D=奈良県&w=1&nm=1000&im=0&submit=2
sen.e: Tenman-jinja Shrine is located on the southern tip of the village of Obara, in the hills halfway down the Ossaka-kaido Road (National Route 166) which connects Ouda and Sakurai through the Meyori-toge Pass.
sen.cmt: end > tip. hilly area > hills. connecting > which connects.
sen.e: Tenman-jinja Shrine is located on the southern tip of the village of Obara, in the hills halfway down the Ossaka-kaido Road (National Route 166) which connects Ouda and Sakurai through the Meyori-toge Pass.

sen.j: 寺はその裏手に隣接した高台にあった。
sen.e: The temple was located on the hill adjoining the back of the shrine.
The temple was located on a hill behind the shrine.
sen.cmt: the > a/ adjoining the back > behind
sen.e: The temple was located on a hill behind the shrine.
Position
Position
Position

sen.j: 発掘調査が行われていないため、伽藍の規模や配置など詳しいことは不明である。
sen.e: Since there is no excavation and research conducted, the details including the scale and the layout of the temple are unknown.
Since no excavations or research have been conducted, details such as the scale and the layout of the temple are unknown.
sen.cmt: there is no > no...have been. including > such as.
sen.e: Since no excavations or research have been conducted, details such as the scale and the layout of the temple are unknown.

sen.j: 現在は塔跡に心礎や礎石などが確認できるほか、東側の一段低くなった場所にも礎石が並べられている。
sen.e: Today, the central base of the pagoda and the foundation stone can be seen at the site of which the pagoda used to be, and the foundation stones are placed in the eastern side, which is one step lower.
Today, the central base and foundation stone can be recognised at the site of which the pagoda used to be, and further foundation stones are arranged on the eastern side, which is one step lower.
sen.cmt: seen > recognised. the foundation stones > further foundation stones.placed > arranged.
sen.e: Today, the central base and foundation stone can be recognised at the site of which the pagoda used to be, and further foundation stones are arranged on the eastern side, which is one step lower.

sen.j: ただし東側の礎石は元からこの場所にあったのではなく、塔跡の西側にある十三重石塔が建てられているあたりから運ばれたと見られている。
sen.e: The foundation stones in the eastern side were not orginally placed there; they are thought to have been moved from the place where the thirteen-storied stone pagoda is located in the western side of where the pagoda used to be.
The foundation stones on the eastern side were not orginally placed there; they are thought to have been moved from the site of a thirteen-storied stone pagoda which stands to the West.
sen.cmt: in > on. place where > site of. in the wester side > which stands to the West.
sen.e: The foundation stones on the eastern side were not orginally placed there; they are thought to have been moved from the site of a thirteen-storied stone pagoda which stands to the West.

sen.j: 石塔が建てられている場所は通称「コンドー」と呼ばれていて礎石もいくつか確認でき、ここに金堂があったと考えられている。
sen.e: Since the place where the stone pagoda is located is named 'Kondo', and that some of the foundation stones can still be seen, a kon-do (golden hall) is thought to have been located there.
Since the area where the stone pagoda stands is named 'Kondo', and some of the foundation stones can still be recognised, a kon-do (golden hall) is thought to have been located there.
sen.cmt: place area. located > stands. seen > recognised.
sen.e: Since the area where the stone pagoda stands is named 'Kondo', and some of the foundation stones can still be recognised, a kon-do (golden hall) is thought to have been located there.

sen.j: 談山神社が所蔵する『談山神社国宝』（国宝）に刻まれた銘文によって、寺の由緒がはっきりとしている。
sen.e: The history of the temple is clearly stated in the inscription on the "Tanzan-jinja Shrine Kokuho" (a national treasure) owned by Tanzan-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 談山神社国宝:定訳不明次の原文に「この伏鉢」と書かれていることから、伏鉢を指しているのではないかと思われますが、不明のため、そのまま訳してあります。
sen.e: The history of the temple is clearly stated in the inscription on the "Tanzan-jinja Shrine Kokuho" (a national treasure) owned by Tanzan-jinja Shrine.
The history of the temple is clearly stated in the inscription on the "Tanzan-jinja Shrine Kokuho" (a national treasure) owned by Tanzan-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: この伏鉢は古代の金文の重要な資料として国宝に指定されるとともに、寺跡も史跡に指定された。
sen.e: The fukubachi (inverted bowl-shaped part on top of a pagoda), which is an important material for learning about gold letters in ancient time is designated as a national treasure, and the site of the temple is also designated as a historic site.

The fukubachi (inverted bowl-shaped section on top of a pagoda), an important material for learning about ancient golden letters, is designated as a National Treasure, and the site of the temple is also designated as a Historical Landmark
sen.cmt: part > section. which isを省略しました。
sen.e: The fukubachi (inverted bowl-shaped section on top of a pagoda), an important material for learning about ancient golden letters, is designated as a National Treasure, and the site of the temple is also designated as a Historical Landmark

sen.j: 銘文によると、中臣大島が草壁皇子を忍び寺の設立を発願した。
sen.e: According to the inscription, NAKATOMI no Oshima wished to establish the temple for Prince Kusakabe.
According to the inscription, it was NAKATOMI no Oshima's wish that the temple be established for Prince Kusakabe.
According to the inscription, it was NAKATOMI no Oshima's wish that the temple be established for Prince Kusakabe.

sen.j: 大嶋の死後、比賣朝臣額田によって甲牛年（持統天皇8年、694年）に起工し金堂・丈六の釈迦像が造られた。
sen.e: After Oshima died, Hime no Ason Nukata broke ground in 694, and a kon-do and a Joroku Shyaka zo(4.85 meter high statue of Shakyamuni) were made.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After Oshima died, Hime no Ason Nukata set to work and in 694 a kon-do and a Joroku Shyaka zo (4.85 metre-high statue of Shakyamuni) were built.
sen.cmt: broke ground > set to work. made > built.
sen.e: After Oshima died, Hime no Ason Nukata set to work and in 694 a kon-do and a Joroku Shaka zo (4.85 metre-high statue of Shakyamuni) were built.

sen.j: 22年後の和銅8年（715年）に三重塔が完成したと記されている。
sen.e: 22 years later in 715, it was described that the three-storied pagoda was alco completed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: 22 years later in 715, it was recorded that the three-storied pagoda had been completed.
22 years later in 715, it was recorded that the three-storied pagoda had been completed.

sen.j: 大嶋は文献でも名前が確認できる人物であるが、比賣朝臣額田に関してはいっさい不明である。
sen.e: Although Oshima's name was mentioned in literatures, Hime no Ason Nukata was not.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although Oshima's name was mentioned in literature, Hime no Ason Nukata was not.
Although Oshima's name was mentioned in literature, Hime no Ason Nukata was not.

sen.j: 一部に万葉歌人の額田王ではないかとする説も出されている。
sen.e: This made some people assume that Hime no Ason Nukata is Nukata no Okimi, the Manyo kajin (a poet responsible for Manyoshu [the oldest anthology of poems]).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Some also claim the theory that Hime no Ason Nukata was the same person as Nukata no Okimi, the poet responsible for Manyoshu (Japan's oldest poetry anthology).
sen.cmt: SOme people assume > Some also claim the theory. is > was the same person as.
sen.e: Some also claim the theory that Hime no Ason Nukata was the same person as Nukata no Okimi, the poet responsible for Manyoshu (Japan's oldest poetry anthology).

sen.j: ⇒詳しくは額田王の記事を参照
sen.e: =>For more information, refer to the article about Nukata no Okimi.
=>For more information, refer to the article about Nukata no Okimi.
=>For more information, refer to the article about Nukata no Okimi.
